meanings.definition: The quality of being reliable or deserving of trust.
meanings.sent1: Her trustworthiness in keeping secrets made her a good friend.
meanings.sent2: The company's success was built on the trustworthiness of its products.
meanings.sent3: His trustworthiness in always returning borrowed items promptly earned him the nickname 'Mr. Reliable'.
meanings.sent4: The trustworthiness of the old lighthouse guided ships safely through the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The trustworthiness of the lock ensured the safety of the valuable documents inside.

meanings.definition: The ability to be trusted or relied upon.
meanings.sent1: The dog's trustworthiness in guarding the house was unmatched.
meanings.sent2: In times of crisis, people look for leaders with trustworthiness to guide them.
meanings.sent3: The trustworthiness of the weather forecast was questioned when it predicted sunshine but it rained all day.
meanings.sent4: Her trustworthiness in always being on time made her the perfect candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: The trustworthiness of the bridge held strong even during the heavy traffic hours.

meanings.definition: The trait of being honest and dependable.
meanings.sent1: His trustworthiness in telling the truth even when it was hard earned him respect.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's trustworthiness in grading fairly was appreciated by all students.
meanings.sent3: The trustworthiness of the clock was put to the test when it stopped working during the exam.
meanings.sent4: The trustworthiness of the compass was crucial for the hikers to find their way back.
meanings.sent5: The trustworthiness of the mechanic was evident in the way he fixed the car without overcharging.
